l.del: In gardens where the roses bloom,

l.add: Beyond the gates where time stands still,
Where goldensilver moonbeams climb the hill,

l.del: I wander through the fragrant gloom,

l.add: The ancient garden keeps its secrets deep,

l.del: And hear the blackbird's distant call.

l.add: While all the world lies fast asleep.
No fountain here, but streamsrivers wide,

l.del: Of love and loss beneath the moon,

l.add: That speaksing of ages centuries past with pride,

l.del: While autumn wind through garden rails,

l.add: The weathered stones remember when,
This place was youngnew, and green again.

l.del: Time passes like the flowing stream,

l.add: Eternity dwellslives in this space,

l.del: Through gardens old and ever new,

l.add: Where past and future all of time interlace,

l.del: Where memories dance and gently gleam,

l.add: Each petal holds a thousand years,
Each dewdropraindrop holds our joys hopes and fears.
The garden waits, forever still,
For those who seekknow its mystic ways,
Beyond the realm of human will,
It blooms through all our mortal days.
So when you find this secret hidden door,
And step into its gentlesacred light,
Remember those who came before,
And vanished in the endless night.
